result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noah M. Sanders

defendant.name: Sanders, Noah M.
defendant.address: Fox Lake Correctional PO Box 200, Fox Lake, WI 53933

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Transcript of Plea Hearing held on 3/4/16 before Judge Wambach
of the Review Hearing held on April 14, 2016 before the Honorable David J Wambach

Cases 16CM109, 15CM206, 15CM251, 15CM347 called together at 10:49am
Defendant Noah M. Sanders in court, in custody with Attorney Jeremy Christopher Evans.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel
Statement made by Mr. Sanders

As to Case 15CM206:
The Court sentences Defendant to:
--serve 90  days in Jefferson County Jail, this sentence is to be served consecutive to all other sentences in being
--to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System as Mr. Sanders in currently serving a Prison sentence
--the court orders all costs and fees be converted to civil judgement; to include $66 in subpoena fees incurred by the State
--0 days credit for time already served given


As to Case 15CM251:
The Court sentences Defendant to:
--On Count #1: to serve 6 months in the County Jail, to be served consecutive to the sentence in 15CM206
--On Count #2: to serve 30 days in the County Jail, to be served consecutive to the sentence in 15CM206 and Count #1
--On Count #3: to serve 30 days in the County Jail, to be served consecutive to all other sentences in being 
--On Count #4: to serve 30 days in the County Jail, to be served consecutive to all other sentences in being 
--all to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System as Mr. Sanders in currently serving a prison sentence 
--the court orders all costs and fees be converted to civil judgement; to include $73 in subpoena fees incurred by the State
--0 days credit for time already served given

As to Case 15CM347:
--On Count #1: the Court orders 30 days in the County Jail, to be served consecutive to all other sentences in being
--On Count #2: the Court orders 30 days in the County Jail, to be served consecutive to all other sentences in being
--On Count #3: the Court orders 30 days in the County Jail, to be served consecutive to all other sentences in being
--On Count #4: the Court orders 30 days in the County Jail, to be served consecutive to all other sentences in being
--On Count #5: the Court orders 30 days in the County Jail, to be served consecutive to all other sentences in being
--all to be served in the Wisconsin State Prison System as Mr. Sanders in currently serving a prison sentence 
--0 days credit for time already served given
--the court orders all costs and fees be converted to civil judgement


Upon inquiry of the Clerk, the Court indicates that all these sentences are to be served without Huber privilege
The Court finds that Mr. Sanders has previously submitted a DNA sample.

recess: 11:52am
Review hearing on April 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Cases 16CM109, 15CM206, 15CM251, and 15CM347 called together at 11:20am [mo]
Defendant Noah M. Sanders in court, in custody with Attorney Jeremy Christopher Evans.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance

As to Case 16CM109:
The Court finds probable cause to exist within the Criminal Complaint

As to All Cases: 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed
recess: 11:30am--reconvene: 11:38am (to allow Atty. Evans to review the CC in 16CM109 with Mr. Sanders)

Pleas of " GUILTY " entered on Case 15CM347 Counts #1, #2, #3, #4 and #5 and Case 15CM251 Counts #1, #2, #3, and #4

ADA Teuber indicates that a Motion for an Amended Criminal Complaint was submitted; there is no objection from Atty. Evans
--the Court grants the State's Motion for the Amendment of the Criminal Complaint.

The Defendant pleads "GUILTY" to the the Charge in the Amended Complaint of Case 15CM206,

factual basis stipulated;the Court accepts pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State and Joint Recommendation of the Parties, the Court reads in and dismisses: all remaining counts of Cases 15CM347 and 15CM251 and Case 16CM109
recess: 12:02pm

[[post hearing: ADA Teuber submits the original signed Amended Criminal Complaint for Case 15CM206]]

NEXT: As to All Cases: Sentencing on 4/14/16 at 10:00am ((16CM109 to follow as review))
